title: Tales of the Unranked
body:
Hail summoners everywhere! 
Gather round for I have a tale of grand adventure and wonder!
Of a young impressionable summoner who went out and tried to make a name for themselves.
The summoner trained for over a year after hitting 30 before running head first into the ranked queues.
They learn't every role trying to be a good flexible player, able to fit any team.
Be it a selfless support or a tanky top, bursty mage, brawly jungler and even death dealing ADC they practiced and studied.
Learning the ways of the rift, the frozen lane, the kite and fight, the baron dance and steal and even the legendary fail flash.... This was a silly time yet and fun one too and this was a time of wonder and laughter.
Learning the meta, practicing the roles and loving the fun and satisfaction of improving.
And the thrill of victory, the ability to hold their head high and say, "Yes I held my lane, I fought and I won, Leading the charge to victory!"
Even to go so far as learn tactics and plays, when to push, how to bait out an enemy and reading the map like they could see the very code of the game.
They even learnt the value of vision, a truly wondrous day which they shall never forget. Warding is not just for supports.
Buy a pink. See a gank. Save a life.
Then after a year of play the summoner looked back on how far they had come. 
All those battles wins and loses, good times and bad, lessons learnt.
And decided yes now is the time to step into the legendary ranked queues.
Now their time had come.

The summoner was not prepared for what they found.

The competitive scene, the higher level of this Legendary League was no civilised contest of skill and teamwork.
It was a brutal, violent arena home to the aggressive and the angry.
To the summoner this came as a shock and shattered their belief. 
The ranked arena was full of abuse and hate, harsh words and the infamous troll. The afk player and the feeder.
No one seemed happy or even to respect each other regardless of teams. 
Even in victory most were aggressive and taunting. 
Verbal hate flowed thicker than the blood that stained the rifts soils.
Team work was but a distant memory. 
All the tactics and lessons the summoner had learnt seemed pointless in the face of a fight not only against the enemy team on the rift but his own allies as well.
Fresh faced level 30's greeted this summoner.
Players who apparently knew everything there was to know about this world, so any advice and calls for logic were meet with abuse and flame.
These same players who choose to bring a champion they had never played before into the rift...
The summoner was plagued by the afk, the troll, the flamer and the feeder.
This summoner now stands 2 and 6 knowing that though they could have played better and did make mistakes they didn't flame didn't troll didn't feed and didn't afk. 
They fought and struggled never giving up trying to make good on their dreams of some respectable rank, silver would have been a dream come true.
Now this dream, has become a nightmare.
The summoner called out to the game masters and reported the players who did not live up to the summoners code.
But not a word was heard.
No action was taken.
The young hopeful summoners voice was lost and the cries for some action any action to be taken to fix the worst kind of players was ignored.
It was with a heavy heart the summoner realised that even if they had the best of intentions they were only one and no one could hear their call to judge the guilty and punish the abusive.
To fix this system of hate of a toxic community which lets the wicked prosper.
So the summoner now stands at a cross roads.
Should they continue on into this ranked world, full of hate and hope to pull through? 
Or try to return to the normal queues with the hope to find the fun and joy they ounce knew.

replies.body:
**Join a ranked team.** You get a ranking, rewards, and you won't have to put up with the toxicity of solo que. Advertise yourself in the "team recruitment session', find people looking for teams or simply make your own. That way you can continue improving your own skills, all while improving as a team and climbing the ranked ladder. 

(Disclaimer; some people in some ranked teams are complete ♥♥♥♥♥ and are just as toxic as players in solo que. It will take a while to find a team that is right for you but you shouldn't give up, keep searching and you will get there.)

Good luck ♥

as unranked bronze or silver its nearly impossible to find a decent ranked team to join (one that plays more than 5 games a season before disbanding) 
so your best bet is to get a group of friends you play with regularly and try to convince them to play ranked teams every now and then...and make sure they dont CARE about the rank. its just for fun.
